critique: The document establishes a uniform program for managing controlled unclassified information (CUI) across executive departments and agencies. It aims to address inconsistencies in marking and safeguarding documents, unclear dissemination policies, and impediments to authorized information sharing. The order designates the National Archives and Records Administration as the Executive Agent to implement and oversee compliance. It emphasizes openness and uniformity in government-wide practice, requiring agencies to review and catalogue their categories of CUI. The document includes provisions for developing CUI categories and policies, establishing a public CUI registry, and consulting with various stakeholders. It also addresses general provisions related to law, agency authority, and budgetary considerations.
